alert.note: Alert for Floyd (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 25 at 7:38AM EST until February 27 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Kentucky... Levisa Fork Big Sandy River at Prestonsburg affecting Floyd County. For the Big Sandy River...including Elkhorn City, Pikeville, Prestonsburg, Paintsville...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Levisa Fork Big Sandy River at Prestonsburg. * WHEN...From this morning to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Flood gate is closed to the storm drain system in Prestonsburg. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM EST Friday the stage was 21.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.0 feet this evening. - Action stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 40.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. The next statement will be issued by 11 AM Friday.
